posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
I do not see a lot of dual-wield builds (except, of course, Kama Monks). What are the inherent weaknesses to dual wielding (besides the feat investment & loss of shield?

Also, if a PC has Two Weapon Fighting with a light weapon in the off-hand and the Ambidexterity feat, is the AB penalty -2/+2?

Is there value to ITWF at low levels?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi Theophilus.

Perhaps this link will help in your quest for d-w answers: 1/2-handed/d-w weapons

As to AB penalties, you're right about the AB penalty with both TWF and Ambidexterity. You will, of course need a DEX of 15+ in order to take Ambidexterity (unless you take Ranger and its inherent D-W feat/s).

When you take ITWF is a matter of personal taste, by and large (provided you have BAB of 9+). For myself, I prefer to wait until my AB is higher before grabbing that extra off-hand attack. After all, if you take it when it first becomes available, you'll be making the attack at -7 from your optimal AB (-5 if a kama Monk), and you're not going to hit much then without a 20 roll. There are probably more beneficial feats that could be taken earlier instead. But then, I tend to take all d-w feats later than many here do anyway.

Cheers
